title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 8): Sharing What We Need - Tool & Seed Libraries as Power With in Action
summary: Create prefigurative systems of mutual support by sharing tools and seeds collectively. Break consumer dependency while building relational infrastructure that reinforces trust and care.

Community.summary: Build shared resource infrastructure that creates connection and reduces individual dependency.

level0: Start small and local with a few interested people
Choose accessible location like garage, community garden, or shared space
level1: Build culture of trust rather than surveillance - use community agreements
Keep structure horizontal with rotated roles and consensus decisions
level2: Design for use not perfection - focus on function over fancy systems
Invite contribution without pressure - let people offer what feels meaningful
level3: Make it gathering point with seasonal events and skill shares
Create sustainable model others can replicate

Knowledge.summary: Share practical skills and build collective capacity for self-reliance.

level0: Map existing tools and seeds in community
Learn basic maintenance and organization skills
level1: Host tool sharpening and repair workshops
Organize seed saving and garden planning sessions
level2: Teach others how to start their own libraries
Share knowledge about horizontal organizing methods
level3: Become regional resource for community sharing infrastructure

Money.summary: Reduce individual costs while creating abundance through shared resources.

level0: Break cycle of individual tool and seed purchasing
Start with what community already has available
level1: Organize tool donation drives and repair of existing items
Create systems for sharing costs of new shared resources
level2: Calculate community savings from shared vs individual ownership
Reinvest savings into expanding shared infrastructure
level3: Model alternative economy based on sharing rather than accumulation
Support other communities in reducing costs through sharing

Narrative.summary: Shift from ownership and scarcity to sharing and abundance mindset.

level0: Practice sharing resources without tracking or punishment
Challenge myths about scarcity and individual ownership
level1: Share stories about community abundance through cooperation
Model trust-based systems for resource access
level2: Help others understand tools and seeds as community wealth
Promote sharing economy principles in neighborhood
level3: Transform community culture toward abundance and generosity
Build widespread understanding of commons as alternative to capitalism
